value: Remains of old temple at Fullara

.

According to mythology, when Mahadeva danced around with Satiâ€™s dead body cutting it to pieces, the lip fell at Fullara. The old temple has been destroyed and a new temple has been built. Only some broken pillars of the old temple remain. There is a big pond beside the temple. According to hearsay, Hanuman collected 108 blue lotuses from the pond when Sri Ramachandra required them for the worship of goddess Durga. It is considered to be one of the fifty-one shakti peethas in India.
One could also come here from Kankalitala, which is about 19 kms.
Traditional Teracotta works can be bought from here.
There are small eateries in Labhpur bus stand.
Only tea is available in Labhpur bus stand.
